questions.text: “Grey baby syndrome” following statements are true except

options.label: A

questions.text: Which of the following statements about the fluoroquinolones is FALSE?

options.label: A
options.text: A fluoroquinolone is the drug of choice for treatment of an uncomplicated urinary tract infection in a 7-year-old girl

options.label: B
options.text: Modification of fluoroquinolones dosage is required in patients if creatinine clearance is less than 50 mL/min

options.label: C
options.text: Gonococcal resistance to fluoroquinolones may involve changes in DNA gyrase

options.label: D
options.text: Fluoroquinolones inhibit relaxation of positively supercoiled DNA

questions.correct_answer: A. A fluoroquinolone is the drug of choice for treatment of an uncomplicated urinary tract infection in a 7-year-old girl

questions.text: Which of the following statements about sulfonamides is FALSE?

options.label: A
options.text: Sulfonamide crystal Luria is most likely to occur at low urinary pH

options.label: B
options.text: Dysfunction of the basal ganglia may occur in the newborn sulfonamides are administered late in pregnancy

questions.correct_answer: C. Sulfonamides inhibit bacterial dihydrofolate reductase

questions.text: This inhibitor of bacterial protein synthesis has a narrow spectrum of antibacterial activity. It has been used in the management of abdominal abscess caused by Bacteroides fragilis, but antibiotic associated colitis has occurred. Which of the following drugs i8 being described?
Bactericidal inhibitors of protein synthesis are
The following tetracycline has the potential to cause vestibular toxicity
Regarding the antibacterial action of gentamicin, which of the following statements is most accurate?

options.label: A
options.text: Efficacy is directly proportionate to the time that the plasma level of the drug is greater than the minimal inhibitory concentration

options.label: B
options.text: The antibacterial action of gentamicin is time dependent

options.label: C
options.text: Antibacterial activity is often reduced by the presence of an inhibitor of cell wall synthesis

options.label: D
options.text: Gentamicin continues to exert antibacterial effects even after plasma levels decrease below detectable range

questions.correct_answer: D. Gentamicin continues to exert antibacterial effects even after plasma levels decrease below detectable range

questions.text: Concerning streptogramins, which one of the following statements is FALSE?

options.label: A
options.text: They are active against methicillin-resistant staphylococci

options.label: B
options.text: They may cause a syndrome of arthralgia and myalgia

options.label: C
options.text: They are used in the management of infections caused by vancomycin-resistant enterococci

options.label: D
options.text: They induce formation of hepatic drug metabolizing enzymes

questions.correct_answer: D. They induce formation of hepatic drug metabolizing enzymes

questions.text: Which one of the following statements about doxycycline is FALSE?

options.label: A
options.text: It is more active than tetracycline against H. pylori

options.label: B
options.text: It is excreted mainly in the feces

options.label: D
options.text: It is used in Lyme's disease

questions.correct_answer: A. It is more active than tetracycline against H. pylori

questions.text: A 36 years old woman recently treated for leukemia is admitted to the hospital with malaise, chills and high fever. Gram stain of blood reveals the presence of gram negative bacilli. The initial diagnosis is bacteremia and parenteral antibiotics are indicated. The record of the patient reveals that she had severe urticarial rash, hypotension and respiratory difficulty after oral penicillin V about 6 months ago. The most appropriate drug should be
The following is true of vancomycin EXCEPT

options.label: A
options.text: It can cause deafness as a dose related toxicity

options.label: B
options.text: It acts by inhibiting bacterial protein synthesis

options.label: C
options.text: It is an alternative to penicillin for enterococcal endocarditis

options.label: D
options.text: It is a bactericidal antibiotic active primarily against gram positive bacteria

questions.correct_answer: B. It acts by inhibiting bacterial protein synthesis

questions.text: Amoxicillin + clavulanic acid is active against the following organisms EXCEPT
Methicillin resistant staphylococci do not respond to B-lactam antibiotics because

options.label: A
options.text: They have acquired penicillin binding protein which has low affinity for P-lactam antibiotics

options.label: B
options.text: They elaborate an amidase which destroys methicillin and related

options.label: C
options.text: They produce a p-lactamase which destroys methicillin and related

options.label: D
options.text: They are less permeable to P-lactam antibiotics

questions.correct_answer: A. They have acquired penicillin binding protein which has low affinity for P-lactam antibiotics

questions.text: Which of the following statements about imipenem is most accurate?

options.label: A
options.text: The drug has a narrow spectrum of antibacterial action

options.label: B
options.text: It is used in fixed dose combination with sulbactum

options.label: C
options.text: Imipenem is active against methicillin-resistant staphylococci

options.label: D
options.text: In renal dysfunction, dosage reductions are necessary to avoid toxicity

questions.correct_answer: D. In renal dysfunction, dosage reductions are necessary to avoid toxicity

questions.text: Which of the following statement about the bio disposition of penicillin’s and cephalosporin’s is NOT accurate

options.label: A
options.text: Oral bioavailability is affected by lability to gastric acid

options.label: B
options.text: Renal tubular reabsorption of beta-lactams is inhibited by probenecid

options.label: C
options.text: Procaine penicillin G is used via intramuscular injection

options.label: D
options.text: Nafcillin and ceftriaxone are eliminated mainly via biliary secretion

questions.correct_answer: B. Renal tubular reabsorption of beta-lactams is inhibited by probenecid

questions.text: Which of the following drugs is NOT excreted in bile
Which of the following is not an established antimicrobial drug synergism at clinical level?

options.label: A
options.text: Amphotericin B and flucytosine in cryptococcal meningitis

options.label: B
options.text: Carbenicillin and gentamicin in pseudomonal infections

options.label: C
options.text: Trimethoprim and sulfamethoxazole in coliform infections

options.label: D
options.text: Penicillin and tetracycline in bacterial meningitis

questions.correct_answer: D. Penicillin and tetracycline in bacterial meningitis

questions.text: The persistent suppression of bacterial growth that may occur after limited exposure to some antimicrobial drug is called
All of the following antibiotics act by interfering with cell wall formation EXCEPT
Antihelminthic also acting as immunomodulator is:
Which of the following antibiotics has a unique mechanism of action by inhibiting bacterial topoisomerase IV in addition to DNA gyrase?

Which antibiotic is known to have a mechanism of action involving the inhibition of bacterial protein synthesis by binding to the 23S rRNA of the 50S ribosomal subunit and very effective against anaerobic infections?
Which of the following antibiotics has a high risk of causing Stevens-Johnson syndrome (SJS) as a rare but serious adverse effect?
Which of the following antibiotics is known to cause irreversible ototoxicity, particularly in high doses or prolonged use?
Which of the following antibiotics should be avoided in patients with a history of glucose-6-phosphate dehydrogenase (G6PD) deficiency due to the risk of hemolytic anemia?
Which antibiotic use is contraindicated in pregnancy due to its potential to cause dental staining and bone development issues in the fetus?
Which of the following antibiotics is known to cause 'red man syndrome' due to the release of histamine upon rapid infusion?
Which antibiotic is known for its potential to cause a disulfiram-like reaction when alcohol is consumed?
Which of the following antibiotics is known for its mechanism of action involving binding to the 30S ribosomal subunit and preventing tRNA attachment?
Which antibiotic is known to be the first-line treatment for infections caused by Clostridium difficile?
Which antibiotic is primarily used for the treatment of multi-drug resistant Gram-positive infections, including vancomycin-resistant enterococci (VRE)?
Which of the following antibiotics is known for its ability to penetrate well into the central nervous system and is used for treating bacterial meningitis?
Which antibiotic is known to inhibit bacterial folate synthesis by competitively inhibiting dihydropteroate synthase?
Which of the following antibiotics is known to interact with dairy products and antacids, reducing its absorption due to chelation?
Which antibiotic is associated with the development of a potentially life-threatening condition known as serotonin syndrome, particularly when used with other serotonergic agents?
Which of the following antibiotics is known for causing potential blood dyscrasias, including agranulocytosis and aplastic anemia?
Which antibiotic is known to cause 'black box' warnings for potential hepatotoxicity and should be monitored carefully in patients with liver disease?
Which of the following antibiotics can cause a 'gray baby syndrome' in newborns due to its metabolism by the liver and lack of conjugation ability in infants?
Which antibiotic is known for causing tendon rupture, especially in the Achilles tendon, and is contraindicated in patients on concurrent corticosteroid therapy?
Which antibiotic is known for its ability to bind to and inhibit bacterial DNA gyrase and is commonly used to treat infections caused by Pseudomonas aeruginosa?
Which antibiotic is known to be effective against anaerobic bacteria and is often used in combination with other antibiotics to treat mixed infections involving anaerobes?
Which of the following antibiotics can cause a potentially severe allergic reaction known as serum sickness, particularly after prolonged use?
Which antibiotic is known for its unique mechanism of action involving the formation of reactive intermediates that damage bacterial DNA?
Which of the following antibiotics is known to be contraindicated in patients with a history of myasthenia gravis due to its potential to exacerbate muscle weakness?
Which of the following antibiotics is known for its potential to cause nephrotoxicity, particularly when used with other nephrotoxic agents?
Which of the following antibiotics is known to be effective against MRSA and has a unique mechanism of action that disrupts cell membrane potential?
Which antibiotic is a known inhibitor of bacterial protein synthesis by binding to the 30S ribosomal subunit, but is also associated with causing phototoxicity?
Which antiviral drug is commonly used as a first-line treatment for chronic hepatitis B infection and acts by inhibiting viral DNA polymerase?
Which of the following nucleotide analogue, antiviral drugs is specifically used for the treatment of HIV and works by inhibiting the reverse transcriptase enzyme?
Which antifungal drug is used for treating systemic fungal infections and is known for its potential nephrotoxicity & arrhythmias?
Which antifungal drug acts by inhibiting ergosterol synthesis and is used topically for fungal infections?
Which antiprotozoal drug is used for the treatment of giardiasis and works by forming free radicals that damage protozoan DNA?
Which antimalarial drug is known for its use in both the treatment and prevention of malaria and is effective against Plasmodium vivax due to its action on the liver stages?
Which of the following antimalarial drugs is known for its rapid onset of action and is often used in combination with other drugs to treat severe malaria?
Which anti-helminthic drug is known for its effectiveness against strongyloidiasis and onchocerciasis, and works by stimulating paralysis in the worms?
Which of the following drugs is used as a pre-exposure prophylaxis (PrEP) to reduce the risk of HIV infection in high-risk individuals?
